greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Least non-divisor of n.
comment: Least k >= 2 such that sigma(n) divides sigma(n*k), where sigma is A000203. - _Benoit Cloitre_, Dec 01 2002
Contains all and only the prime powers p^k, k > 0. The first occurrence of p^k is at A003418(p^k-1); so new records occur at indices in A051451. - _Franklin T. Adams-Watters_, Jun 13 2011
link: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
formula: a(n!) = prime(pi(n) + 1) for n >= 0, except for a(3!) = 4. (End)
maple: for k from 2 while n mod k = 0 do od:
mathematica: Table[k := 1; While[Mod[n, k] == 0, k++]; k, {n, 2000}]  (* _Clark Kimberling_, Jun 16 2012 *)
Join[{2, 3}, Table[Complement[Range[n], Divisors[n]][[1]], {n, 3, 100}]] (* _Alonso del Arte_, Sep 23 2017 *)
program: (PARI) a(n) = {my(k=2); while(!(n % k), k++); k;} \\ _Michel Marcus_, Sep 25 2017
xref: Cf. also A266620 (least non-divisor of n!).
results.author: _Jeffrey Shallit_
